availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alex Wessen (Calloway County, KY, farmer and prov govt)

body.p: Calloway County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Nancy Wesson. Father of Henry Wesson, Mary Wesson, Benjamin Wesson, and Isaac Wesson. Tobacconist in Calloway County in 1850. Employed James R. Brimm as a tobacconist in Calloway County in 1850. Employed William H. Thaston as a farmer in Calloway County in 1850. Owned twelve enslaved persons in Calloway County in 1850. Farmer in Calloway County in 1860. Owned twenty-seven enslaved persons in Calloway County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861.

ab.bibl:
